newsitem.title: USA: U.S. stocks seen starting lower on profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: U.S. stocks seen starting lower on profit-taking.

text.p: Wall Street stocks are expected to open lower with bonds on Wednesday as the equity market comes in for profit-taking, after the Dow rallied 173 points yesterday, the second biggest advance in its history.

"There will be some predictable profit-taking at the start," one trader said. "It seems that yesterday's euphoria in the bond and stock markets wore off overnight. Everyone is back to worrying about all the numbers that will come out next week, including the April employment report."
U.S. Treasuries moved lower, with the long bond down 6/32 to yield 7.06 percent.
The Standard & Poor's 500 Index Futures contract for June was down 1.15 at 779.70.
Johnson said that a decline in the stock market would be moderated by the flow of good earnings reports.
